name: jsonpatcher
description: Language support for scripts for the JsonPatcher minecraft mod

jsonpatcher.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the JsonPatcher language server.

jsonpatcher.java.location.description:
An override for the java executable to use. Must be java 21 or later. If empty, then the JAVA_HOME environment variable is used instead.
Note: You need to restart the server for this setting to apply

jsonpatcher.java.options.description:
Additional VM options for the JVM running the language server. Be careful not to cause anything to be printed to stdout as it will interfere with lsp communications.
Note: You need to restart the server for this setting to apply

jsonpatcher.server.enabled.description:
Allows toggling the language server off. It's recommended to keep the server on whenever possible.
Note: You need to restart the server for this setting to apply

jsonpatcher.server.location.description:
An override for the location of the language server jar. Must be the -all variant with all libraries included. Leave empty to use the bundled server.
Note: You need to restart the server for this setting to apply

jsonpatcher.server.port.description:
The port that the language server will listen on for the client. Change this if the default is being used by some other application.
Note: You need to restart the server for this setting to apply

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
